about.title: About Me
about.text: I'm a French-and-English-speaking globe-trotting programmer with over 8 years of programming experience. I love taking on problems in weird but effective ways. I'm currently based in Montréal.

skills.title: Skills
skills.text: Fluent in Java, HTML/CSS, JavaScript (frontend and Node), Python, and Zig. Knowledgeable in C#, Go, and PowerShell. Experienced with Svelte, Express, and SASS (and a bunch more - reach out!)

experience.title: Creating, Expanding, Maintaining Zig Language Server
points: Creating intellisense tooling that accelerates thousands of Zig developers.
Working hand-in-hand with team of contributors and other maintainers.
Developing comprehensive fuzzing solution to ensure seamless user experience.

experience.title: Designing, Developing Zig Conference Website
points: Working with Vancouver stakeholders to design and develop remotely from Montréal.
Adapting designs to an existing Go-based internal solution.
Ensuring full functionality and accessibility.

experience.title: Created Zig Indexer for Sourcegraph (Freelance)
points: Adapted Zig Language Server code to statically index Zig code.
Tested solution on Sourcegraph servers.
Worked with stakeholders to ensure timely delivery, even as a full-time student.

experience.title: Directed The Snitch Satirical News Website
points: Wrote, edited, and webmastered a school satirical journal that I co-founded in Maryland.
Worked with large writing and editing team to keep output continuous and high-quality.
Designed the website and implemented it with a Node backend.

experience.title: Rewrote Bibliothèques Sans Frontières' Ideas Box Frontend
points: Proposed and began reimplementing Quasar frontend in Svelte.
Collaborated with team members to ensure proper functionality carry-over.
Helped ensure continuation of work I had begun by training teammates.

experience.title: Taught at Non-Profit CoderDojo DC
points: Taught 6 - 17 year olds Scratch, Python, and HTML / CSS / JavaScript in Maryland.
Helped people with no access to computers at home acquire computer literacy skills.
Configured Rockville Memorial Library Science Center space to optimize teaching.

experience.title: Taught at GeekExpress
points: Taught 5 - 14 year olds in Beirut twice a week and full-time in July 2018.
Developed curriculums around app, web, and XR development.
Helped expand company to local schools.

experience.title: Implemented Cryptography Backend at CryptoPHI
points: Worked in Beirut once a week and full-time in June 2018 on backend code.
Collaborated with cryptography PhD on secure storage implementation.
Translated PHP components of the old backend into Node.

experience.title: Prototyped Hardware at Innovo
points: Created a circuit prototype with minimal guidance in Beirut.
Manufactured PCB using EAGLE, a CNC machine, and a healthy dose of soldering.
Thoroughly tested PCB to ensure full functionality was delivered.
